intro: Crepidiastrum saxatile, commonly known as the rock crepidiastrum, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and succulent leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or pink in color, often arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique morphology and ability to survive in harsh environments make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
